data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Administration of a government chiefly through bureaus or departments staffed with nonelected officials.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The departments and their officials as a group.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: promised to reorganize the federal bureaucracy.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Management or administration marked by hierarchical authority among numerous offices and by fixed procedures.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: The new department head did not know much about bureaucracy.

data.text: The administrative structure of a large or complex organization.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a midlevel manager in a corporate bureaucracy.

data.text: An administrative system in which the need or inclination to follow rigid or complex procedures impedes effective action.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: innovative ideas that get bogged down in red tape and bureaucracy.

data.text: Government by bureaus; specifically, excessive multiplication of, and concentration of power in, administrative bureaus.
The body of officials administering such bureaus, considered collectively.

A system of carrying on the business of government by means of departments or bureaus, each under the control of a chief, in contradiction to a system in which the officers of government have an associated authority and responsibility; also, government conducted on this system.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
